About.title: About Me
About.description: Hi, I'm Rosanna Contasti, a frontend developer experienced in React and React Native. I love bringing projects to life using tools like MUI, Tailwind, Bootstrap, and Styled Components, always with a focus on responsive design to ensure everything looks great on any device. I believe frontend development is more than just code: it's a mix of creativity and functionality, where every component and every style contributes to an experience that truly connects with people. I love that challenge!

Projects.title: Projects
Projects.firstProjectDescription: An application developed with React Native and Styled Components for Proyecto Sirenas, an Argentine initiative founded by Agostina Bisio. The goal of the app is to support women in adopting healthier lifestyle habits and improving their quality of life. The app includes features such as live video streaming, an audio and video gallery, chat with a partner and the community, and a matching system for mutual support in the weight loss journey. It also offers a calendar and agenda, food tracking, hydration, sleep, mood, and exercise logs, along with tools to upload photos and view personal statistics. In the payment section, support is provided for bank transfer, MercadoPago, and PayPal.
Projects.secondProjectDescription: Web version of the Sirenas app, designed for desktop and tablet. It includes key features such as live streaming and forum interaction, optimized for a smooth and visually appealing experience on large screens. Perfect for connecting with the Sirenas community from desktop and tablet.
Projects.thirdProjectDescription: Designed as an internal tool to manage users, activities, and statistics for the Sirenas mobile application. The admin panel allows the administrative team to monitor app usage, edit content, and efficiently manage the user community.
Projects.fourthProjectDescription: In progress. Website developed for BIOI, a construction company focused on civil engineering, sustainable architecture, and real estate development.
